subject: p12145137
History: Evaluation of patient with abdominal pain and lactic acidosis.
Findings: Again identified is a left juxta-hilar mass adjacent to a fiducial seed and a right hilar mass. Multiple other nodules are also identified but better delineated on recent CT. Otherwise, the lungs are without a focal consolidation or pneumothorax. A small right pleural effusion is noted. An overlying left subclavian central line is visualized in place. There is stable elevation of the left hemidiaphragm. No free air is noted in the abdomen.
Impression: Findings consistent with known intrathoracic malignancy. No evidence of infection or other acute process.
